publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2175# David McLetchie: Congestion Charging Scheme Referenda—That the Parliament congratulates West Lothian Council for agreeing to hold a consultative referendum on the City of Edinburgh Council’s congestion charging scheme and for setting a question which conforms with the guidelines issued by the Electoral Commission and regrets that the City of Edinburgh Council, in its referendum, has proposed for answer a question which does not conform with these guidelines and intends to circulate an information leaflet with the ballot paper which will not include statements from parties opposed to the scheme. Supported by: Phil Gallie*, Alex Johnstone*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, David Mundell*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*
S2M-2175# Congestion Charging Scheme Referenda (lodged on 15 December 2004) Mr David Davidson*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Murray Tosh*

S2M-2175# David McLetchie: Congestion Charging Scheme Referenda—That the Parliament congratulates West Lothian Council for agreeing to hold a consultative referendum on the City of Edinburgh Council’s congestion charging scheme and for setting a question which conforms with the guidelines issued by the Electoral Commission and regrets that the City of Edinburgh Council, in its referendum, has proposed for answer a question which does not conform with these guidelines and intends to circulate an information leaflet with the ballot paper which will not include statements from parties opposed to the scheme. Supported by: Phil Gallie, Alex Johnstone, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, David Mundell, Mr Ted Brocklebank, Mr David Davidson, Mr Brian Monteith, Murray Tosh
S2M-2175# Congestion Charging Scheme Referenda (lodged on 15 December 2004) Mary Scanlon*, Miss Annabel Goldie*
S2M-2175# Congestion Charging Scheme Referenda (lodged on 15 December 2004) Margaret Mitchell*, John Scott*
S2M-2175# Congestion Charging Scheme Referenda (lodged on 15 December 2004) Mrs Nanette Milne*
